before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"flbjl","text":"The tissue used in the steps below were obtained after processing as described in Protocol: Immunofluorescent Labelling of Post-Mortem Rodent Brain Tissue. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":72}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5586947ED63E445B9C3BEF447694AB72","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.j8nlkkq31l5r/v1"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5irrl","text":"This protocol details confocal image acquisition steps and the analysis pipeline used to calculate inter-soma distance between cholinergic interneurons/pMSNs and their nearest astrocyte. The partner Protocol: Immunofluorescent Labelling of Post-Mortem Rodent Brain Tissue describes how to label cholinergic interneurons/pMSNs along with striatal astrocytes in PFA perfusion-fixed, 50-µm thick, post-mortem rodent brain tissue. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":199,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":199,"length":72}],"data":{}},{"key":"e7n8a","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14cfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpqgv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DC30349F255745499675952D23AADBAE","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.j8nlkkq31l5r/v1"}}}}

Blue (Zeiss, version 3.9)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"73ckn","text":"FIJI (version 1.54f)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"51gnh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2imk3","text":"Other:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77juc","text":"Slide with ~50 µm thick brain section with fluorescent labels.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hqpt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8FB05009966B4CC3B0C8D178187ED54F","url":"https://www.zeiss.com/microscopy/en/products/light-microscopes/confocal-microscopes/lsm-980-with-airyscan-2.html?_gl=1*3xhuzs*_up*MQ..\u0026gclid=Cj0KCQjw6PGxBhCVARIsAIumnWZJdVTv_GYkdRIvzv6rGtKLAmjE_q0kCarbw_O9f35FgVgJkKfh3Z8aAvgnEALw_wcB"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D319CD6EFD834C0A987E88D2AC236A49","url":"https://www.zeiss.com/microscopy/en/products/software/zeiss-zen.html"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4CC2220ADAC146198036475B4C7BA98A","url":"https://imagej.net/software/fiji/downloads"}}}}

parent_collections.title: Stedehouder, J. and Roberts, B.M. et al. (2024) Rapid modulation of striatal cholinergic interneurons and dopamine release by satellite astrocytes

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"es9n2","text":"Turn on the Leica LSM980 confocal microscope and Zen Blue imaging acquisition software.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mh1","text":"Using a 10x objective, identify anatomical landmarks using the DAPI or ChAT/NeuN signal in the region of interest. This would include the corpus callosum for the dorsal striatum, and the anterior commissure for the ventral striatum.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lqbl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3rfl1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":49,"style":"bold"}],"key":"35vc1","text":"The DAPI signal would be visualised with a 358 nm laser. The ChAT/NeuN signal can both be visualised with a 568 nm or similar wavelength laser as appropriate for the secondary fluorescent antibody used.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi4f","text":"Switch to a 63x/1.4 NA (oil immersion) objective and identify randomly selected ChAT/NeuN positive somata within the region of interest. Center the objective over this particular neuron. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20el3","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l3k5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9431r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":86,"style":"italic"}],"key":"6t1qf","text":"Only include neurons for which the full soma resides within the z-axis of the tissue (e.g., no cut neurons). ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"104gn","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c37sj","text":"Take care to identify somata while blinded to the S100β (green) channel, to prevent bias to selecting ChAT/NeuN cells that have an astrocyte (as identified by a positive S100β signal) close to them.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39j0d","text":"Image the identified cell across the different channels using the following lasers:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bbg7","text":"ChAT/NeuN - 568 nm wavelength laser","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jrn4","text":"S100β - 488 nm wavelength laser","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dah4n","text":"DAPI - 358 nm wavelength laser ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5aui5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nfes","text":"The laser wavelength can also be altered as appropriate for the secondary antibody that is used.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gtb2","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mj1p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6c4o1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":240,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8n2r7","text":"The settings used were a 30 µm thick z-stack (512 x 512 pixels) at 63x magnification with 1x digital zoom, 1 µm optical thickness/optical plane, and a step size of 2 µm. The z-stack centre was set to z-coordinate where the soma is largest (e.g. centre of the neuron).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"364v7","text":"Save the images with the appropriate details of the sample and imaging settings. A .czi format is recommended but other formats could also work.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67cca","text":"Open the images in FIJI (ImageJ) and convert to a maximum projection across the z axis.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1hbi1","text":"While remaining blind to the S100β (green) channel to prevent bias on astrocyte location, draw a region of interest (ROI) around the cell in the centre of the image with the polygon selection tool. This would either be the ChAT/NeuN positive cell, depending on the sample.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2edd7","text":"Open the S100β (green) channel. Draw a ROI around the nearest astrocyte by identifying a signal in the S100β (green) channel (\u003e5 µm in diameter) featuring a DAPI-positive nucleus residing closest to centre of the image.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35i0r","text":"From the ROIs, measure the surface area of the cells and the x and y coordinates of the centre point to calculate the intersoma distance.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bre5o","text":"Using the x and y coordinates obtained earlier, calculate the Euclidean distance between the centre point of the ChAT/NeuN cell and their nearest astrocyte.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk7it","text":"Secure a glass slide containing one or more fluorescently-labelled brain section into the stage of the microscope. Take care at this step to ensure the coverslip does not break or dislodge. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ktp","text":"Move to the next cell in the region of interest. Repeat image acquisition across the desired number of cells. Sample an equal number of cells from both hemispheres.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eqcct","text":"Repeat analysis steps outlined above for all imaged cells.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Imaging of cholinergic interneurons in post-mortem rodent tissue to identify striatal satellite astrocytes
title_html: Imaging of cholinergic interneurons in post-mortem rodent tissue to identify striatal satellite astrocytes
